commitResults.messageTitle: Change chatbot name to Jerry and removed all traces of Duke
Added Echo feature to Jerry class
commitResults.messageBody: Jerry will now echo back whatever the user types.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added support for a list of task in Jerry class
commitResults.messageBody:
Added a taskList ArrayList variable to hold all the tasks

Added a printList() method to print the current tasks

Change the previous echo method name to addTask, and modified it to add
the user's task

Minor changes/addition:
- added second keyword, 'list'. This is the keyword by the
user to list out the tasks
- change addTask() and printList() to be instance method, thus a
  constructor is needed for jerry

Jerry can now add task inputted by the user to an ArrayList and display
back that list to the user

commitResults.messageTitle: Added new class called Task and methods that support it
commitResults.messageBody:
Task contains a description of the task and a boolean value to track if
the task has been done or not

toggleIsDone() method to change the isDone value of the task

getStatusIcone() method returns an icon depending on isDone value

commitResults.messageTitle: Parse userInput and use swtich statement over if statements in Jerry class
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- parsing userInput into words, the first word is the command
- use swtich statement to switch between user commands.

Rationale:
Now that more complex commands are introduced, userInput has to be
split such that the userCommand can be extracted and we know that the
command is the first word. Switch statement is used as it is cleaner.

What else to do:
- implement the addTask() method as the default case
- implement the markTask() and unmarkTask() methods

commitResults.messageTitle: Implemented addTask() method and change type parameter of ArrayList
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- Change type parameter of ArrayList to be Task
- Implemented addTask() method and use it as the default command

Rationale:
- Task class is created therefore the type parameter of ArrayList needs
  to be change to Task. Since each Task, now, needs to hold a state

What else to do:
- implement Mark and Unmark commands
- slight modification to printList to follow the type parameter of the
  ArrayList

commitResults.messageTitle: Implemented both Mark and unmark commands
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- added markTask() and unmarkTask() method to handle their respective
  commands
- added a getTask() method

Rationale:
- the getTask() method is added so the code isnt repeated 2 times in
  each of the markTask() and unmarkTask() method and also it isolates
  the errors that Integer.parseInt() will throw.

what else to do:
- change printList() so that it prints the StatusIcon of each task

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug where Mark/Unmark command is off by 1 and add printTask()
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- Mark/Unmarked was off by 1 index, fixed by minusing 1
- added printTask() into Task class
- minor fixes to the formatting of some System.out.println messages

Rationale:
- printTask() is added for better encapsulation

commitResults.messageTitle: Change printTask() to toString() in Task class
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- printTask() method renamed to toString()
- minor formatting of printing

Rationale:
- toString() is cleaner as i do not have to call it

commitResults.messageTitle: Add empty ToDo.java file
Add empty Deadline.java file
Add empty Events.java file
Implemented Deadline class
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- Extends Task because a Deadline is a task
- Added "by" attribute
- Added constructor that calls the parent's constructor
- Override toString()

commitResults.messageTitle: Implemented ToDo class
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- Extends Task class as ToDo is a task
- Create constructor for it that calls Task's constructor
- Override toString()

commitResults.messageTitle: Implemented Events class
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- Extends Task as Events is a task
- Added 2 attributes: to and from attributes
- Override toString()

commitResults.messageTitle: Minor formatting of addTask() output
Make Task class abstract
commitResults.messageBody:
Rationale:
- this is so that there will not be any accidental "new Task()" and only
  allows the 3 types of Tasks to be used only

commitResults.messageTitle: Added Todo command feature in Jerry class
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- dismantle the previous addTask() method into 2 separated methods : 1 for printing
  and 1 for adding
- the printing method is shared by all 3 types of Tasks
- Added addToDoTask() method, to specifically do "new ToDo()"

commitResults.messageTitle: Added Deadline command feature in Jerry class
Minor renaming and cleaning for cleaner code
Minor renaming of Event classname and filename
Added Event command feature in Jerry class
Added inputs and expected outputs to useability
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- added typical and correct usage of commands by a user
- added the expected outputs for those inputs
- tested all commands and worked
- did not test edge cases yet

what to do next:
- write edge cases

commitResults.messageTitle: Added invalid commands edge case
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- added invalid commands by user e.g. spelling mistake, not a command

what to do next:
- output a more detail message to handle invalid command error

commitResults.messageTitle: Added DukeException class
Added and handled InvalidCommandException
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- added InvalidCommandException as a subclass exception of DukeExcepttion
- modified Jerry class to handle it

This exception is Duke specific

commitResults.messageTitle: Modified Expected-invalid-commands.txt to better suit the updated exception output
Added EmptyInput as a subclass of InvalidCommand exception
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously when user enters " " or "", it will result in InvalidCommand
and ArrayIndexOutOfBound exceptions. I decided to classify these 2 input
as EmptyInput and made it a subclass of InvalidCommand so it will also output
the COMMAND_LIST to show the user what commands there are.

Changes:
- Added EmptyInputException Class
- Modified userInput to trim out start and end whitespaces so that i can
  classify "" and " " as EmptyInputs
- Made COMMAND_LIST in InvalidCommandException class

commitResults.messageTitle: Added a emptyInput test case into input-Invalid-commands.txt
Handled mark/unmark missing argument
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- Added a MissingArgumentException class to catch missing arguments
- modified existing code to work with new exception

commitResults.messageTitle: Handled repeated un/marking of the same task
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- added RepeatedActionsException class to help handle cases where user
  mistakenly mark or unmark the same task more than once
- modified existing code to work with new exception

commitResults.messageTitle: Handled un/mark exceptions caused by Integer.parseInt or Array bounds
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- Added WrongArgumentException class to deal with NumberFormatException
  when the argument is not a number and IndexOutOfBoundsException when
  the argument exceeds the ArrayList bounds

commitResults.messageTitle: Modified InvalidCommands test cases to only be for that exception
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- removed un/mark commands that are not related to InvalidCommands
- changed the corresponding Excpected.txt file as a result
- implemented .bat to run all input.txt file instead of 1 by 1

commitResults.messageTitle: Added un/marked commands edge test cases and expected output
Handled todo command missing argument exception
Added edge test cases for todo and deadline
commitResults.messageBody:
This is to observe the actual output and exceptions throw by java so
that i can handle each case

commitResults.messageTitle: Handled and added more deadline command edge test cases
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- the /by keyword unique to deadline command is now non case sensitve
- missing arguments of the deadline command is also handled

Making the /by keyword non-case sensitive makes it easier to handle the
edge cases of it and better user experience so as user will not keep
running into errors over small things

commitResults.messageTitle: Added edge test cases for event command
Handled event command edge cases
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- the keywords, /from /to, are now non case sensitive
- added the corresponding expected file too

commitResults.messageTitle: Gave each jerry exception their own unique message
Renamed DukeException.java to JerryException.java
Modified Expected outputs as i changed some output messages
spelling mistake in unmark message output
Implemented delete command and handled its exceptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- delete command exceptions are handled by existing exception handlers
- added deleteTask() method

commitResults.messageTitle: Modifed Expected files as a result of a new command
Added edge test cases for delete command and expected output for it
Implemented Enums for commands
commitResults.messageBody:
Changes:
- Added new Commands Enum file
- a getCommand method to return the specific Command
- moved the default throwing of InvalidCommandException to enum class
